meanings.definition: A person who steals from others.
meanings.sent1: The robber stole money from the store.
meanings.sent2: The police caught the robber red-handed.
meanings.sent3: The robber tried to steal a cookie from the jar, but got caught.
meanings.sent4: His greedy behavior made him a robber of joy.
meanings.sent5: The notorious robber was finally apprehended by the authorities.

meanings.definition: To take property unlawfully from (a person or place) by force or threat of force.
meanings.sent1: She watched as the thief tried to robber the jewelry store.
meanings.sent2: The masked man attempted to robber the bank but failed.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly said he would try to robber the candy shop next.
meanings.sent4: The storm seemed to robber the trees of their leaves overnight.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds seemed to robber the sky of its light.
